bib.title: Elastic And Inelastic Scattering Of Neutrons In The Energy Range 2 To 5 Mev By B-10 And B-11

free_txt: preprint to Nucl.Phys.(not published)
AWRE 6 MV Van de Graaff accelerator.
SD:Updated to new date formats,lower case.
MONIT-REF was added. Major corrections in all Subents.
ANALYSIS deleted (info moved to ADD-RES).
Liquid scintillator (NE213) (see REL-REF)
* A separate fixed time of flight spectrometer viewing
the target cell was used throughout as a monitor by
means of which neutron yields at different angles were
compared.
AWRE 6 MV Van de Graaff accelerator.
Up to 4.312 MeV, T(p,n) reaction, tritium
gas target at 760 Torr pressure with an 0.0003 cm
thick Mo entrance foil
For higher energy, D(d,n) reaction with a
similar target cell.
By the special care for runs using D-D neutron source
and by optimizing the beam transmission, synchronous
backgrounds of neutrons were kept to a minimum, ie,
+- 2.5% of the 0. deg. neutron yield.
The error limits on n-energies are a
combination of the energy loss in the gas cell and
calibration uncertainties.
Time of flight, flight path = 1.747 m,
time resolution in the TOF spectra was broadened by
large dimensions of scattering samples, but was
sufficient to resolve the 1st excited state in B-11
at all energies used.  In B-10, neutrons scattered to
the 1st excited state were only satisfactorily
resolved at two lowest energies.
The scattering at 45 deg from
the polythene sample was measured.
- experim.
procedures described
- The neutron
detection system described
Decay data and their uncertainties
The MAGGIE program
.Isotopically enriched boron powder in annular
cylindrical aluminium cans.
.The wall thickness was 0.025 cm and the
internal dimensions were, height = 5.05 +- 0.09 cm,
inner diameter = 2.498 +- 0.005 cm, outer diameter =
In calculating cross sections, corrections were made
for flux attenuation and multiple scattering using
the Monte Carlo code program MAGGIE.
.For elastic peak estimates,
(A) contamination neutrons
(B) energy reduction of elastically scattered neutron
by light nuclei multiple collision (shift to inelastic
region of the time spectrum),
(C) the scattered neutrons from the collimator-wall,
(D) random counts due to electronic noise and
background neutrons and gammas, were considered
to be corrected.
The error represents one standard deviation,
they are a combination of the relative errors and
the absolute error from the normalization.
- the relative error is taken as that on the area
derived by integration of the Legendre polynomial fits
(even and odd terms) to the data)
the absolute error is from the normalization to
hydrogen and uncertainties from the sample composition
and impurities plus the effect of the Al can screening
.Isotopic composition,
.The estimate of the amount of hydrogen
contamination is  1.8% H by atom in B-10.

In calculating cross sections, corrections were made
for flux attenuation and multiple scattering using
the Monte Carlo code program MAGGIE.
.For inelastic peak estimates, corrections due to
separation of inelastic group from elastic peak and
the presence of H-contamination are considered.
The error represents one standard deviation,
they are a combination of the relative errors and
the absolute error from the normalization.
- the relative error is taken as that on the area
derived by integration of the Legendre polynomial fits
(even and odd terms) to the data)
the absolute error is from the normalization to
hydrogen and uncertainties from the sample composition
and impurities plus the effect of the Al can screening
The experimental runs for 4.312 and 4.338
MeV have been combined as the overlapping ones.
Although the apparent duplication of work at neutron
energies 4.312 and 4.338 MeV is unfortunate, it does
provide a check on the extraction of inelastic cross
sections from backgrounds due to the tails from elastic
peaks and from other sources such as the hydrogen
contamination. It thus allows an estimate of errors due
to circumstances which otherwise are difficult to
quantify.
.Isotopic composition,
.The estimate of the amount of hydrogen
contamination is  1.8% H by atom in B-10.

The experimental runs for 4.312 and 4.338
MeV have been combined as the overlapping ones.
Although the apparent duplication of work at neutron
energies 4.312 and 4.338 MeV is unfortunate, it does
provide a check on the extraction of inelastic cross
sections from backgrounds due to the tails from elastic
peaks and from other sources such as the hydrogen
contamination. It thus allows an estimate of errors due
to circumstances which otherwise are difficult to
quantify.
